edges.label: Batch: typeText on #username, [name="username"], input[autocomplete="username"] with text "admin" → typeText on #password, [name="password"], [type="password"] with text "admin123" → clickElement on button[type="submit"], .login-button, button:has-text("Login"), button:has-text("Sign in")
Batch: clickElement on button.toast-close → clickElement on button.delete-button
Batch: typeText on #username with text "new_user_test" → typeText on #password with text "password123" → clickElement on button.create-button

stories.title: User Login Flow
stories.description: As a user, I want to securely log in to the application so that I can access the user management dashboard.
steps: Enter username 'admin' into the username field.
Enter password 'admin123' into the password field.
Upon successful authentication, I am redirected to the user list page.

flow.action: Enters username and password, then clicks the 'Login' button.

stories.title: User Management Flow: Create and Cancel
stories.description: As an administrator, I want to create new users to grant them access, and I want the ability to cancel the process and return to the user list.
steps: From the user list page, click the 'Create User' button in the header.
I am taken to the user creation form.
Enter a new username, for example, 'new_user_test'.
Enter a new password, for example, 'password123'.
Click the 'Create' button to add the new user.
I am immediately redirected to the user list page, and a success toast notification appears confirming the user was created.
Alternatively, if I decide not to create a user, I can click the 'Back' button to return to the user list without saving.

flow.action: Clicks the 'Create User' button in the header.
Fills in the new user's username and password, then clicks the 'Create' button. The user is created and I am redirected to the user list page with a success toast notification.
Clicks the 'Back' button to cancel the creation process.

stories.title: User Management Flow: Delete User
stories.description: As an administrator, I want to delete a user from the list to revoke their access.
steps: On the user list page, locate the user I want to remove.
Click the 'Delete' button corresponding to that user.
The user is removed, and the user list is updated.

flow.action: Clicks the 'Delete' button for a user in the list.

userStories.summary: The application is a simple user management system. The primary user journey involves logging in to access a dashboard where an administrator can view a list of users. From this list, the administrator can navigate to a separate form to create new users or delete existing users directly from the list.
